text: are you tempted in any way to call a
snap election I think what's important
particularly having had the referendum
vote is that we have a period of
stability and there's a challenge ahead
in May in ensuring that we make a
success of coming out of the European
Union I think it's important we focus on
that and the other reform agenda that I
have for the country as we go forward
and we'll be continuing the manifesto on
which the Conservative government was
elected in 2015 so I don't think there's
a need for an election I think the next
election will be in 2020
maybe it's very clear because again it's
very important under current law the
next election will be in 2020 no ifs no
buts no snap elections no changing the
law under you is that absolutely certain
that we're not going to see an election
before I mentally I'm not going to be
calling a snap election I'd be very
clear that I think we need that period
of jiying that stability to be able to
deal with the issues that the country is
facing and have that election in 2020
